message.content:
1. The subjects in the study have unmedicated Major Depressive Disorder (MDD).
2. The subjects were assigned to receive rtfMRI-nf.
3. The rtfMRI-nf was from either the left amygdala or the horizontal segment of the intraparietal sulcus.
4. The experimental group was assigned to receive rtfMRI-nf from the left amygdala.
5. The number of subjects in the experimental group was 14.
6. The control group was assigned to receive rtfMRI-nf from the horizontal segment of the intraparietal sulcus.
7. The number of subjects in the control group was 7.
8. The subjects were instructed to contemplate happy autobiographical memories.
9. The purpose of contemplating happy autobiographical memories was to raise the level of a bar.
10. The bar represented the hemodynamic signal from the target region.
11. The goal was to raise the bar to a target level.

messages.content:
Statement: Unmedicated MDD subjects were assigned to receive rtfMRI-nf from either left amygdala (LA; experimental group, n = 14) or the horizontal segment of the intraparietal sulcus (HIPS; control group, n = 7) and instructed to contemplate happy autobiographical memories (AMs) to raise the level of a bar representing the hemodynamic signal from the target region to a target level.

List all the facts we explicitly know from the statement. Make each fact as atomic as possible.
